title: Restoring Firefox profile after Windows 10 Reinstallation
content:
Hi guys,

Recently my primary hard drive crashed and I had to replace the drive and completely reinstall the Windows 10 OS. I have cloud backup and I was able to recover the folder C: > ProgramData > Mozilla. Please see attached. Is it possible to restore my Firefox profile with these files, or is there something else I should look for in the backup? Please let me know. Any help is greatly appreciated.

title: I can't use Youtube. I appear logged in but actually I'm not.
content:
I'm having login problems on Youtube with Firefox 82.0.2 64bit on Win 7 SP2.

I appear logged into my Youtube account but I can't comment, like, dislike, edit comment etc... Safe Mode also didn't help. Deleting cookies and cache didn't help. I tried using another account on New Private Window mode and it didn't help either.

Chrome works on the same Win 7 machine without any problem.

I appear logged in on the top right side of the page while appering NOT logged in on the same page, in the top left Youtube Menu. If I try to log in using the button on the left, I get this message; "405. That’s an error. The request method GET is inappropriate for the URL /youtubei/v1/guide. "

I also get a "Your session has expired" message if I click on Subscribe button on any channel.

This problem appeared today, after I updated Firefox. Please help.
creator: taseron

title: How to use search engines independently of language settings
content:

Basically, this means I cant use this feature properly (since I cant seem to add amazon.de, either) if I choose a language different from the country I live in.

Is there any solution? I tried to find English (German) language settings, like I set in my operating system, but there is none.

title: FF won't open starting with ver. 82
content:
Hello. After upgrading to ver. 82 FF won't start, there is now browser window visible, just an hourglass spinning for 1-2 seconds and nothing afterwards. In Task Manager I can see a problem being sent, I have 55 such messages all pointing to faulty ntdll.dll, here is the content of one of the latest:

Description Faulting Application Path: R:\Firefox\firefox.exe

Problem signature Problem Event Name: BEX64 Application Name: firefox.exe Application Version: 82.0.2.7605 Application Timestamp: 5f98802b Fault Module Name: ntdll.dll Fault Module Version: 10.0.18362.1049 Fault Module Timestamp: b5beef21 Exception Offset: 00000000000a1170 Exception Code: c0000409 Exception Data: 000000000000000a OS Version: 10.0.18363.2.0.0.256.48 Locale ID: 1048 Additional Information 1: 50b8 Additional Information 2: 50b895deeef5921a02fba247c9dd6405 Additional Information 3: 619c Additional Information 4: 619c7d0fa07c1509eb3427bc293dc637

Extra information about the problem Bucket ID: b7d8504b0515a562dcd16170b678c7d1 (2076548039920109521)

I'm now using ver. 81 because nothing else worked, I tried the clean install method but it was just a waste of time. Thank you.

creator: jec4

title: Google drive resources do not open (SSL certificate issue)
content:
Hello,

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 64-bit, all latest security updates installed. Browser: Firefox 82.0.2

Issue: after FF upgraded past 81, I started experiencing severe problems opening many sites, including Google drive/Google docs/etc resources.

Typical FF behavior: after a long delay I see an error page: site cannot be opened since its credibility can't be proved (original message is in Russian; it may sound differently in English).

According to what I found, that may be related to HSTS.

Workaround: I direct all the problem traffic via external proxy (FoxyProxy, using SSH tunnel-based SOCKS).

Note that when I open the above sites with Google Chrome, without any proxy, no problem happens.

How can I browse, with FF, the sites with the above issue without a proxy?
creator: konstantin2
